We should also call this on `tearDown()` to keep things tidy for other tests.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +63,67 @@        cls.dagbag = DagBag(include_examples=True)
        cls.parser = cli_parser.get_parser()
        clear_db_runs()

    def tearDown(self) -> None:

comments.body: I think this should be `tearDown` not `tearDownClass` because we don’t want the DAG runs to carry over to other tests in the same class.
